main event: A bright, circular object was spotted hovering in the sky about 2,000 feet in the air, approximately 50-75 feet in diameter, near Bakersfield, California on April 6, 1956.
interesting points: The object gave off a brilliant white light and remained stationary for a few minutes before suddenly shooting up into the sky at a very high rate of speed.
The entire sighting lasted about 30 seconds.
The witness believed the object was some type of unusual aircraft, although they could not identify it.
There was no motion, vapor trail, or other apparent activity as the object suddenly appeared and disappeared.
The witness and their friend were puzzled and could not offer any explanation for what they saw.
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
